name: src/Camera.js
Camera
description: A simple wrapper for Three.js camera.

name: src/Coordinates.js
getNutationAndObliquity
description: Get Earth's obliquity and nutation at a given date.

return.description:
Object with attributes "obliquity" and "nutation" provided
in radians

name: getObliquity
description: Get Earth's obliquity at a given date.

name: src/Ephem.js
Ephem
description: A class representing Kepler ephemerides.

params.name: initialValues
params.description:
A dictionary of initial values. Not all values
are required as some may be inferred from others.

params.name: initialValues.GM
params.description:
Standard gravitational parameter in km^3/s^2.
Defaults to GM.SUN.  @see {GM}

params.name: units
params.description: The unit of angles in the list of initial values.

name: set
description: Sets an ephemerides attribute.

params.name: units
params.description: The unit of angle provided, if applicable.

name: get
description: Gets an ephemerides attribute.

params.name: units
params.description:
The unit of angle desired, if applicable. This
input is ignored for values that are not angle measurements.

name: GM
description:
Standard gravitational parameter for objects orbiting these bodies.
Units in m^3/s^2

types: {"SUN": number, "MERCURY": number, "VENUS": number, "EARTH_MOON": number, "MARS": number, "JUPITER": number, "SATURN": number, "URANUS": number, "NEPTUNE": number, "PLUTO_CHARON": number}

name: EphemPresets
description: A dictionary containing ephemerides of planets and other well-known objects.

name: src/KeplerParticles.js
KeplerParticles
description:
An efficient way to render many objects in space with Kepler orbits.
Primarily used by Simulation to render all non-static objects.

params.name: options.basePath
params.description: Base path for simulation supporting files

params.name: options.maxNumParticles
params.description: Maximum number of particles to display. Defaults to 1024

name: addParticle
description: Add a particle to this particle system.

name: update
description: Update the position for all particles

name: get3jsObjects
description: Get THREE.js objects that comprise this point cloud

return.description: List of objects to add to THREE.js scene

name: getId
description: Get unique id for this object.

name: src/Orbit.js
Orbit
description: A class that builds a visual representation of a Kepler orbit.

params.name: ephem
params.description: The ephemerides that define this orbit.

params.name: options.color
params.description: The color of the orbital ellipse.

params.name: options.eclipticLineColor
params.description:
The color of lines drawn
perpendicular to the ecliptic in order to illustrate depth (defaults to
0x333333).

name: _ephem
description: Ephem object

name: _options
description: Options (see class definition for details)

name: _points
description: Cached orbital points.

name: _ellipse
description: Cached ellipse.

name: getPositionAtTime
description: Get heliocentric position of object at a given JD.

return.description: The ellipse object that represents this orbit.

name: getLinesToEcliptic
description:
A geometry containing line segments that run between the orbit ellipse and
the ecliptic plane of the solar system. This is a useful visual effect
that makes it easy to tell when an orbit goes below or above the ecliptic
plane.

return.description: A geometry with many line segments.

name: getHexColor
description: Get the color of this orbit.

return.description: The hexadecimal color of the orbital ellipse.

params.name: hexVal
params.description: The hexadecimal color of the orbital ellipse.

name: getVisibility
description: Get the visibility of this orbit.

return.description:
Whether the orbital ellipse is visible. Note that
although the ellipse may not be visible, it is still present in the
underlying Scene and Simultation.

name: setVisibility
description: Change the visibility of this orbit.

params.name: val
params.description: Whether to show the orbital ellipse.

name: src/RotatingObject.js
RotatingObject
description:
This class simulates an object that spins according to provided rotational
parameters.

name: update
description: Updates the object and its label positions for a given time.

name: get3jsObjects
description: Gets the THREE.js objects that represent this SpaceObject.

name: startRotation
description: Begin rotating this object.

name: stopRotation
description: Stop rotation of this object.

name: src/ShapeObject.js

params.name: options.shape.shapeUrl
params.description: Path to shapefile if type is "custom"

name: getBoundingObject
description: Specifies the object that is used to compute the bounding box.

name: src/Simulation.js
Simulation
description:
The main entrypoint of a visualization.

This class wraps a THREE.js scene, controls, skybox, etc in an animated
Simulation.

params.name: basePath
params.description: Path to simulation assets and data

params.name: options.startDate
params.description:
The start date and time for this
simulation.

params.name: options.jd
params.description:
The JD date of this simulation.
Defaults to 0

params.name: options.jdDelta
params.description:
The number of JD to add every tick of
the simulation.

params.name: options.jdPerSecond
params.description:
The number of jd to add every
second. Use this instead of `jdDelta` for constant motion that does not
vary with framerate. Defaults to 100

params.name: options.startPaused
params.description:
Whether the simulation should start
in a paused state.

params.name: options.maxNumParticles
params.description:
The maximum number of particles in
the visualization. Try choosing a number that is larger than your
particles, but not too much larger. It's usually good enough to choose the
next highest power of 2. If you're not showing many particles (tens of
thousands+), you don't need to worry about this.

params.name: options.particleTextureUrl
params.description:
The texture for the default
particle system.

params.name: options.camera.initialPosition
params.description:
Initial X, Y, Z
coordinates of the camera. Defaults to [0, -10, 5].

params.name: options.camera.enableDrift
params.description:
Set true to have the camera
float around slightly. False by default.

params.name: options.debug.showAxes
params.description: Show X, Y, and Z axes

params.name: options.debug.showStats
params.description:
Show FPS and other stats
(requires stats.js).

name: addObject
description: Add a spacekit object (usually a SpaceObject) to the visualization.

params.name: noUpdate
params.description:
Set to true if object does not need to be
animated.

name: removeObject
description: Removes an object from the visualization.

name: createObject
description:
Shortcut for creating a new SpaceObject belonging to this visualization.
Takes any SpaceObject arguments.

name: createShape
description:
Shortcut for creating a new ShapeObject belonging to this visualization.
Takes any ShapeObject arguments.

name: createSphere
description:
Shortcut for creating a new SphereOjbect belonging to this visualization.
Takes any SphereObject arguments.

name: createSkybox
description:
Shortcut for creating a new Skybox belonging to this visualization. Takes
any Skybox arguments.

name: createStars
description:
Shortcut for creating a new Stars object belonging to this visualization.
Takes any Stars arguments.

name: createAmbientLight
description:
Creates an ambient light source. This will dimly light everything in the
visualization.

name: createLight
description:
Creates a light source. This will make the shape of your objects visible
and provide some contrast.

params.name: pos
params.description:
Position of light source. Defaults to moving
with camera.

name: renderOnlyInViewport
description:
Installs a scroll handler that only renders the visualization while it is
in the user's viewport.

The scroll handler currently binds to the window object only.

name: zoomToFit
description:
Adjust camera position so that the object fits within the viewport. If
applicable, this function will fit around the object's orbit.

params.name: offset
params.description:
Add some extra room in the viewport. Increase to be
further zoomed out, decrease to be closer. Default 3.0.

params.name: offset
params.description:
Add some extra room in the viewport. Increase to be
further zoomed out, decrease to be closer. Default 3.0.

name: start
description: Run the animation

name: stop
description: Stop the animation

name: getJd
description: Gets the current JD date of the simulation

name: setJd
description: Sets the JD date of the simulation.

name: getDate
description: Get a date object representing current date and time of the simulation.

name: setDate
description: Set the date and time of the simulation.

name: getJdDelta
description: Get the JD per frame of the visualization.

name: setJdDelta
description:
Set the JD per frame of the visualization. This will override any
existing "JD per second" setting.

name: getJdPerSecond
description: Get the JD change per second of the visualization.

name: setJdPerSecond
description: Set the JD change per second of the visualization.

name: getContext
description: Get an object that contains useful context for this visualization

name: getSimulationElement
description: Get the element containing this simulation

return.description: The html container of this simulation

name: getCamera
description: Get the three.js camera

name: getScene
description: Get the three.js scene object

name: getControls
description: Get the three.js controls

name: setCameraDrift
description: Enable or disable camera drift.

params.name: driftOn
params.description: True if you want the camera to float around a bit

name: src/Skybox.js
Skybox
description: A class that adds a skybox (technically a skysphere) to a visualization.

params.name: options.basePath
params.description: Base path to simulation supporting files

name: get3jsObjects
description: A list of THREE.js objects that are used to compose the skybox.

name: getId
description: Get the unique ID of this object.

name: SkyboxPresets
description:
Preset skybox objects that you can use to add a skybox to your
visualization.

name: src/SpaceObject.js
SpaceObject
description: An object that can be added to a visualization.

params.name: options.position
params.description: [X, Y, Z] heliocentric coordinates of object. Defaults to [0, 0, 0]

params.name: options.scale
params.description: Scale of object on each [X, Y, Z] axis. Defaults to [1, 1, 1]

params.name: options.labelText
params.description: Text label to display above object (set undefined for no label)

params.name: options.labelUrl
params.description: Label becomes a link that goes to this url.

params.name: options.hideOrbit
params.description: If true, don't show an orbital ellipse. Defaults false.

params.name: options.basePath
params.description: Base path for simulation assets and data

params.name: options.ecliptic.lineColor
params.description: Hex color of lines that run perpendicular to ecliptic. @see Orbit

params.name: options.ecliptic.displayLines
params.description: Whether to show ecliptic lines. Defaults false.

params.name: options.theme
params.description: Contains settings related to appearance of orbit

params.name: autoInit
params.description:
Automatically initialize this object. If false
you must call init() manually.

name: init
description:
Initializes label and three.js objects. Called automatically unless you've
set autoInit to false in constructor (this init is suppressed by some
child classes).

return.description: A div that contains the label for this object

params.name: newpos
params.description:
Position of the label in the visualization's
coordinate system

name: setPosition
description:
Updates the position of this object. Applicable only if this object is a
sprite and not a particle type.

name: getPosition
description: Gets the visualization coordinates of this object at a given time.

name: update
description: Updates the object and its label positions for a given time.

name: get3jsObjects
description: Gets the THREE.js objects that represent this SpaceObject.

name: getBoundingObject
description:
Specifies the object that is used to compute the bounding box. By default,
this will be the first THREE.js object in this class's list of objects.

name: getColor
description:
Gets the color of this object. Usually this corresponds to the color of
the dot representing the object as well as its orbit.

name: getOrbit
description: Gets the {Orbit} object for this SpaceObject.

name: getLabelVisibility
description: Gets label visilibity status.

name: setLabelVisibility
description: Toggle the visilibity of the label.

name: getId
description: Gets the unique ID of this object.

name: isStaticObject
description:
Determines whether object is static (can't change its position) or whether
its position can be updated (ie, it has ephemeris)

return.description: Whether this object can change its position.

name: isReady
description: Determines whether object is ready to be measured or added to scene.

name: SpaceObjectPresets
description: Useful presets for creating SpaceObjects.

name: src/SphereObject.js
SphereObject
description: Simulates a planet or other object as a perfect sphere.

name: src/Stars.js
getColorForStar
description: Maps spectral class to star color

return.description: Color for star of given spectral class

name: getSizeForStar
description: Returns the pixel size of a star.

params.name: minSize
params.description: {Number} Pixel size of the smallest star

name: Stars
description:
Builds a starry background that is accurate for the Earth's position in
space.

params.name: options.minSize
params.description:
The size of the smallest star.
Defaults to 0.75

name: get3jsObjects
description: A list of THREE.js objects that are used to compose the skybox.

name: getId
description: Get the unique ID of this object.

src/Units.js
src/shaders.js

src/util.js
getFullTextureUrl
description: Returns the complete URL to a texture given a basepath and a template url.

params.name: basePath
params.description: Base path for simulation data and assets.

name: getFullUrl
description: Returns the complete URL to a texture given a basepath and a template url.
